an4.184:4.1: Then the brahmin Jāṇussoṇi went up to the Buddha,
an4.184:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an4.184:5.1: “Master Gotama, this is my doctrine and view:
an4.184:5.2: ‘All those whose nature is to die are frightened and terrified of death.’”
an4.184:5.3: “Brahmin, some of those whose nature is to die are frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:5.4: But some of those whose nature is to die are not frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:6.1: Who are those frightened of death?
an4.184:6.2: It’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
an4.184:6.5: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’
an4.184:6.6: They sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:6.7: This is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:7.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for the body.
an4.184:7.4: ‘This body that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave it.’
an4.184:7.5: They sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:7.6: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:8.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done good and wholesome things that keep them safe, but has done bad, violent, and corrupt things.
an4.184:8.4: ‘Well, I haven’t done good and wholesome things that keep me safe.
an4.184:8.5: And I have done bad, violent, and corrupt things.
an4.184:8.6: When I pass away, I’ll go to the place where people who’ve done such things go.’
an4.184:8.7: They sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:8.8: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:9.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who’s doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.
an4.184:9.4: ‘I’m doubtful, uncertain, and undecided about the true teaching.’
an4.184:9.5: They sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:9.6: This, too, is someone who is frightened of death.
an4.184:9.7: These are the four people whose nature is to die but are frightened and terrified of death.
an4.184:10.1: Who are those not frightened of death?
an4.184:10.2: It’s someone who is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
an4.184:10.5: ‘The sensual pleasures that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave them.’
an4.184:10.6: They don’t sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:10.7: This is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:11.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who is rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for the body.
an4.184:11.4: ‘This body that I love so much will leave me, and I’ll leave it.’
an4.184:11.5: They don’t sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:11.6: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:12.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who hasn’t done bad, violent, and corrupt deeds, but has done good and wholesome deeds that keep them safe.
an4.184:12.4: ‘Well, I haven’t done bad, violent, and corrupt things.
an4.184:12.5: And I have done good and wholesome deeds that keep me safe.
an4.184:12.6: When I pass away, I’ll go to the place where people who’ve done such things go.’
an4.184:12.7: They don’t sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:12.8: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:13.1: Furthermore, it’s someone who’s not doubtful, uncertain, or undecided about the true teaching.
an4.184:13.4: ‘I’m not doubtful, uncertain, or undecided about the true teaching.’
an4.184:13.5: They don’t sorrow and pine and cry, beating their breast and falling into confusion.
an4.184:13.6: This, too, is someone who’s not frightened of death.
an4.184:13.7: These are the four people whose nature is to die but are not frightened and terrified of death.”
an4.184:14.1: “Excellent, Master Gotama! … From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
